授業目的: 本講義は、国際関係学を学んだことのある受講生を対象に、主要な理論を学び、国際関係学において中心的な議論となる諸テーマへを理解し、国際政治における様々な事象に対する独自の視点を養成する事を目的とする。
到達目標:
以下の諸点を授業の目標として設定しています。
・国際政治学の主な理論を理解する。
・国際政治学の、学問上の主要な議論や問いを学び、独自の分析を行う力をつける。
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: This　class will be conducted in a regular classroom setting from the first class.  Students permitted to take classes online will join via Zoom.  There may be some class cancellations and make-up classes subsequently. In case of cancellation, make-up classes will be held either on days designated by the school or on Saturday (time period would be decided upon consultations between lecturer and students).

トピック.授業外学習2: This is not an introductory course. Students will be expected to have some exposure to the study of International Relations prior to taking this course.  For example, students who have taken another course I teach, "Introduction to International Relations" (offered in fall semester) or other equivalent courses on international relations are eligible to take this course.  Having said that, any students who are enthusiastic about studying International Relations and in English are welcome to attend.  Reading materials will be distributed by email and/or LUNA.

備考　Note
The course has the following three sets of requirements:

1. Regular class attendance and active participation in class based on the required readings.
2. One or more in-class oral report. (The number of the oral report will depend on the
number of students who register for this course. Each student will sign up for one or more required weekly
readings, prepare to orally report them in class. The oral report must include both a summary of
the assigned readings and the student's own reactions to them that are not mere impressions but are based on a
thoughtful analysis.
3. Performance in two debate sessions
4． Final examination

Course grades will be calculated in the following manner:

Class attendance and participation 20%
One or more in-class oral reports 20%
Debate (15% each) 30%
Final examination 30%

Feedback to the final examination will be posted on LUNA after grading is completed.
